joehung302 wrote:
> This might be a little off-topic but since Heritrix relies on a big
> heap (well, at least in my settings) so I thought it might be good
> to share my experience.
>
> On the linux platform I'm testing, I can actually run 32-bit JVM
> with -Xmx3000m. I've seen in this forum talking about the maximum
> heap being 2GB on 32-bit JVM. I'm not sure if you guys are using an
> older kernel that is just not capable of allocating 3GB memory from
> the beginning or someone really tried it and it does not work well.

Thanks for the info Joe.

General 'wisdom' has it that heap can be no larger than about 1.8Gigs 
usually because '...the largest contiguous memory address space the 
operating system can allocate to a process is 1.8GB' (I see this 
rationale in a few places discussing maximum heap size on 32bit) .  I 
tried allocating a larger heap on a few machines here and got the 
classic message:

Error occurred during initialization of VM
Could not reserve enough space for object heap


... but on our opterons with 64-bit OS's -- but 32 bit JVMs -- I was able to
allocate larger than 2Gig heaps (I see yours is a 64-bit kernel -- debian?).
Alls working reliably for you?

St.Ack
